                                              SECTION A

Greek and Roman Tragedy

Answer one question from this section. You should refer to each of the following plays in your answer:
Electra, Trojan Women, Phaedra.

1.    “Justice, even if slow, is certain to come.” (Solon.) Discuss the portrayal of justice in
      each of the three plays you have read in light of this statement.                         [20 marks]


2.    Analyse one scene from each of the three plays you have read, showing how effectively
      the playwright has used the conventions of tragedy.                                   [20 marks]




                                              SECTION B

War to Peace in Augustan Rome and Empire

Answer one question from this section.

3.    Evaluate the actions of Octavian (later Augustus) between the time of the assassination of
      Julius Caesar and the battle of Actium.                                                    [20 marks]


4.    Discuss the effectiveness of Augustus’s attempts at religious, political and social reform
      in Rome.                                                                                   [20 marks]
